EmailTemplate.name: RE: Landing the Big One article (1363109371.0)
EmailTemplate.subject: RE: Landing the Big One article (1363109371.0)
EmailTemplate.textOnly: - - - Clean Clean false false false EN-US X-NONE X-NONE Hi Jeff, It’s great to hear from you, thank you for reaching out. I wanted to follow up on your email and my voicemail and introduce myself as the person at MBO Partners responsible for all new associate and partnership requests. I’ll be your main point of contact to provide you an overview of our services and answer any specific questions you may have. You may easily book a time that is convenient for you on my online schedule by going here <https://my.timedriver.com/8SLYS>. You can also watch a short video about who we are on You Tube <http://youtu.be/zKDzwSTmGv4>. I look forward to speaking with you and sharing more information about MBO Partners! Sara ___________________________________SARA CONDEConsultant Services Advisor MBO Partners t: 703.793.6028f: 703.793.6068e: sconde@mbopartners.com <mailto:sconde@mbopartners.com>w: www.mbopartners.com <http://www.mbopartners.com/> We’ve got some serious perks you’re eligible to win when you refer a friend <http://referral.mbopartners.com/referral-program?r=conde> to MBO Partners! Ask me about them. Notice: This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential. They are intended solely for the use of the individual addressed. If you have received this email in error please notify postmaster@mbopartners.com <mailto:postmaster@mbopartners.com> and permanently delete the e-mail and files. From: Jeff Loughridge [mailto:jeffl@brooksconsulting-llc.com] Sent: Tuesday, March 12, 2013 8:20 AM To: Sara Conde Subject: Landing the Big One article Sara, I enjoyed your article on independents doing business with Fortune 500 companies. I think MBO offers a great service. I've been following your company for a few years, although I haven't had a chance to do business with MBO yet. I noticed that you are based in Northern Virginia. I do most of my data networking consulting work in the Dulles Corridor. I'm curious about your insight into outside staffing needs for the big companies. When you help an independent contractor land business, do you ever hear back from him or her that additional people are needed for a project? The reason I ask is that I'd like to work with MBO. I understand the "bring your own business" model that you mention in the article. I'm wondering if the existing relationships that MBO has with top companies yields information that positions your company to do additional business, perhaps creating a need to draw in other ICs in MBO's network. Jeff L. --Jeff Loughridge Brooks Consulting LLC 703-229-0098 (o) 703-587-0948 (m) http://brooksconsulting-llc.com <http://brooksconsulting-llc.com>
